availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Formerly the HMS Caledonia. Captured by the United States Navy during the War of 1812 in Black Rock, New York. Present in the battle of Lake Erie. After the war, the ship was sold at Preque Isle, Erie County Pennsylvania, in 1915.

bibl.p: Theodore Roosevelt, The Naval War of 1812, or, The History of the United States Navy During the Last War with Great Britain: To Which Is Appended an Account of the Battle of New Orleans (New York: Da Capo Press, 1999); Bud Hannings, The War of 1812: A Complete Chronology with Biographies of 63 General Officers (Jefferson, N.C.: McFarland & Co, 2012), 126, 155, 208.
